explanation: MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE: this macro controls which branch of the function is compiled. To decide whether the in-place loop (which clearly does not reassign the pointer parameters) or the small-code branch (which calls other functions) is used, the analyzer must know the defined compile-time path. MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ (prototype/definition): used in the small-code branch; the analyzer must check its parameter types and body to ensure it does not reassign the pointer parameters passed from this function (e.g., take a char** or otherwise attempt to change the caller's pointer variables). toxdigitvalue (prototype/definition): called from the non-small-code branch; the analyzer should inspect its signature and implementation to ensure it does not perform any operations that would modify the pointer parameters of the target function (even though it is unlikely, the prototype/definition confirms its parameter types and side effects). strlen (prototype): used in the small-code branch to compute lengths passed to other functions; include the declaration to confirm it does not modify its argument. Together these symbols let the next analyst determine which branch is compiled and whether any called function could modify the pointer parameters (str or broken_encoding) in a way that would violate the MISRA rule about modifying function parameters.
